Function Documentation

ErrStatus _AES_CryptData ( HT_AES_TypeDef *  HT_AESn,
AES_DIR_Enum  dir,
u32 *  iv,
u32  length,
u32 *  inputData,
u32 *  outputData 
)

AES Crypt Data.

Parameters:
HT_AESn,:where HT_AESn is the selected AES from the AES peripherals
dir,:Crypt Data's direction
iv,:initial vector table
length,:data size
inputData,:InputData
outputData,:Output Data
Return values:
SUCCESSor ERROR

FlagStatus AES_GetIntStatus ( HT_AES_TypeDef *  HT_AESn,
u32  AES_INTSR_x 
)

Check whether the specified AES interrupt has occurred.

Parameters:
HT_AESn,:where HT_AESn is the selected AES from the AES peripherals.
AES_INTSR_x,:Specify the interrupt status to check. This parameter can be any combination of the following values:
  • AES_INTSR_IFINT :
  • AES_INTSR_OFINT :
Returns:
SET or RESET

Definition at line 317 of file ht32f5xxxx_aes.c.

FlagStatus AES_GetStatus ( HT_AES_TypeDef *  HT_AESn,
u32  AES_SR_x 
)

Check whether the specified AES status has been set.

Parameters:
HT_AESn,:where HT_AESn is the selected AES peripheral.
AES_SR_x,:specify the flag to be check. This parameter can be one of the following values:
  • AES_SR_IFEMPTY : AES Input FIFO is Empty
  • AES_SR_IFNFULL : AES Input FIFO is not Full
  • AES_SR_OFNEMPTY : AES Output FIFO is not Empty
  • AES_SR_OFFULL : AES Output FIFO is Full
  • AES_SR_BUSY : AES is busy when AES is in encrypt/decrypt action and key expansion
Return values:
SETor RESET

Definition at line 196 of file ht32f5xxxx_aes.c.

void AES_IntConfig ( HT_AES_TypeDef *  HT_AESn,
u32  AES_IER_x,
ControlStatus  NewState 
)

Enable or Disable the specified AES interrupts.

Parameters:
HT_AESn,:where HT_AESn is the selected AES from the AES peripherals.
AES_IER_x,:Specify the AES interrupt sources that is to be enabled or disabled. This parameter can be any combination of the following values:
  • AES_IER_IFINTEN :
  • AES_IER_OFINTEN :
NewState,:This parameter can be ENABLE or DISABLE.
Return values:
None

Definition at line 279 of file ht32f5xxxx_aes.c.

void AES_PDMACmd ( HT_AES_TypeDef *  HT_AESn,
u32  AES_PDMA_xFDMAEN,
ControlStatus  NewState 
)

Enable or Disable the AES PDMA interface.

Parameters:
HT_AESn,:where HT_AESn is the selected HT_AESn peripheral.
AES_PDMA_xFDMAEN,:specify the AES FIFO DMA to be enabled or disabled. This parameter can be any combination of the following values:
  • AES_PDMA_IFDMAEN : input FIFO PDMA
  • AES_PDMA_OFDMAEN : Output FIFO PDMA
NewState,:This parameter can be ENABLE or DISABLE.
Return values:
None
